Top Shelf

These books here are literally on the top of my shelf, and I plan to read them at least more than once. They are here for one (or all) of the following reasons:
1) it's been life-changing and shaped the way I went about life , and I'd pretty much recommend it to everyone to at least flip through - it won't be a waste of time.
2) it deeply resonated with me on some personal level and made me understand myself a little better, and I'd strongly recommend it to someone who I feel similar to with regards to some personality trait, thoughts on a particular topic, or past life experiences.

7 Habits of Highly Effective People
Stephen Covey

The Glass Bead Game
Hermann Hess

All the Light We Cannot See
Anthony Doerr

Pretty Good

These books are either classics that I liked, or something I found at least pretty interesting/well-written. They're listed by the chronological order that I read them in (date of completion near the bottom of the notes). If something in the notes speaks to you, I recommend checking them out.

Just Okay
